caption: Best thin slice in Chicago. Great prices and super delicious pizza.
Heavenly slice(s) of home! One of the best NYC pizza joints in town.

I AM IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE! I have an obsession with what i call "floppy pizza" and my boyfriend found us this place and we drive over an hour just for some of your food. perfect little place with fantastic food
The most delicious New York style pizza in Chicago!!!! It's an absolute must try place. You won't be dissapointed!
Got take out plus the Luigi salad. Everything was great. I’ll definitely order again.
Pizza was super good and a great price for a slice of pie!

We ordered a gluten free pizza from Cafe Luigi and the bottom of the pizza was mushy and nearly impossible to get out of their pizza tin. We cooked it for another 10 mins in our oven before we could actually get the pizza out of the tin. At that point the crust still wasn’t sturdy, but was at least able to be eaten. Not sure if it’s the GF crust or if there was a mistake with the bake time but will be hard pressed to try their pizza again.
Very good customer service, The food was amazing.
I thought there was only one place in Chicago to get normal pizza, but it turns out there are two!  A sincere thanks from a New Jersey refugee to you, Cafe Luigi!
Always, hot, fresh & delicious. Generous portions. I love the crust. The only place I like for pizza in Chicago. Reminds me of NY pizza. Makes me homesick for NY. 👍👍
(Translated by Google) The Best Pizzeria No cap🧢  (Original) La Mejor Pizzeria No cap🧢
Best NY pizza in Chicago
Random chick tells you to go in, no REGERTS

Not sure given the current circumstances that the cooking staff could be shorthanded but my order was wildly disappointing. This was soupy and not cooked. The dough was like a sponge and couldn't be kept together. This was so distant in quality from the reviews I read.
Straight trash. Took over an hour and a half to deliver and was lukewarm. One side was folded over on itself. Never again.
These slices are huge and I feel like I get what I pay for!
Really great NY style pizza. So fresh, friendly people, and quick service!
Best pizza, hands down!

Staff was so rude and I waited for my order for 30 min just for 2 slices of pizza! There was an old man who doesn’t know what is smile and he talked about me racist things in Russian but he didn’t know that I speak Russian too even I’m asian
This spot is worth giving a shot. They have large portions for affordable rates. Regularly well kept and with awesome character. Would recommend to others.

Best pizza in Chicago! My father is from queens, NY and my mother is from Brooklyn. Growing up I would always hear them complain about a lack of quality pizza in Chicago. We discovered cafe luigis one day on our way back home from Wrigley and have been eating it ever since. My parents sometimes drive all the way out to the city from downers grove just for a quality pie. The crust is soft and foldable, but not weak. It can support the perfect amounts of cheese and sauce that rest on top of it. The pizza just seems to have more flavor that any others I’ve tried in the city. If your in the area you must stop in and give it a try!

I grew up in New York and spent seven years in Chicago pouting about there was no quality pizza here until I found this place.  It is the real deal.  Definitely the best New York-style pizza I have encountered in the city.  Staff is nice, and the place is clean.
Consistently good quality pizza. Delivery is usually within an hour and pizza is hot and delicious. Well worth the money!

If you like thin crust pizza and top quality ingredients you MUST try this place. They also have salads but c'mon, ain't nobody got time for that. Once you get your baked pizza resist the urge a 2-3 minutes before you start eating it. Don't forget this thing just came out of an extremely hot oven and the cheese and toppings may be extremely hot and melty. By waiting a couple minutes the items will cool down and reduce the risk of cheese and toppings sliding off the slice.

It was ok. Not great. Pizza was cold and I had to heat it up when I got home. Gave it to me in a box that didn't close well so it was a little hard to transport.   New york has a crispier thin crust so I wouldn't compare the two.
Pretty good pizza but don't go in asking for New York style pizza because they don't have it but the advertise it

This place is so tiny, you might never expect much of it. But when I saw the words "New York Style Pizza" (and believe me folks, that's the REAL stuff), smelled the delicious smell before I got through the door, and saw the very happy looking, and clearly prosperous Italian owner of this little place, and his clearly happy cook, and then noticed the place is as spotless as the smells are delicious ... well, the only other thing I have to tell you is that genuine New York style pizza is about as far to find a bite on a cheap burger. So just go, and tell Luigi that Stuart the concert pianist sent you. Then he'll probably give you a big smile 😊.
I went because of the reviews and was disappointed the pizza came out cold and the mushrooms on that pizza came back with a vengeance the next day.
Best N.Y style pizza in town, my usual go to if I am craving a nice juicy slice.
Good thin crust pizza for a decent price!
Great pizza and other Italian favorites
REAL NY slices here, y'all. No frills, just nice pizza and people.
As former East coasters, this is as close to real New York style pizza my family has found here in Chicago.  If you don't live nearby, don't pass up stopping for a slice when you go by!
After 10 years of searching far and wide..cafe luigi is the Closest to NYC pizza in Chicago..said by a native NYC er

Best "real" NY-style pizzaria in the city! Pizza by the slice is always the way to go. I just wish they were open later. The service is good and everyone is very polite. I don't know how they arrive at their prices, since every price ends with random cents.
I love this pizza
Love the crumbled sausage

Hands down some of best thin crust NY style pizza in Chicago. Small unassuming Mom & Pop pizzeria...but those slices are great. The owners are extremely friendly and accommodating. They use finely crumbled sausage, which is my preference. The mozzarella they use has flavor.  The supreme pizza was tasty as well....crust was not soggy. Skip the hipster, artisan joints and check this place out. I highly recommend if you like thin crust pizza!
This is by far the best NY style pizza in Chicago! It’s consistently good.
Real NY style slices...the best.
One of the Greatest NY style pizza in Chicago!
Best NY style in Chicagoland!
Somewhat ny style pizza
Love grabbing a slice on the way home from work, great NY style pizza
Kid friendly, cool desserts, great Russian staff!
I've been looking for a good NYC slice in Chicago for months and finally found this place! Great thin crust. A classic, delicious slice of cheese.
If you like New York style pizza you will love this hole-in-the-wall place. Looks, feels, and tastes like a upper east side pie
THIS is NY style pizza. Excellent pizza and great service.

I am disappointed. I ordered a calzone here. I wanted to eat at Luigi's. The food was served with plastic knife and fork. The calzone came on a stryrofoam plate. The plate was melted of the hot calzone. I ordered with peperoni, mushrooms and sausage. It came a small calzone with hamburger meat & paprika. No spicy peperoni. It was eatable and ok. Wrong incredients and romanticless on plastic while eating inhouse.

Some of the best pizza I've had here in Chicago since discovering NYC Slices.  Don't come here if you're used to Chicago style and think this is "thin crust" you will be sorely disappointed.  What you get here is genuine, flavorful, amazing New York style pizza.  Thank you for existing Cafe Luigi!

The pizza was okay not much to it the flavor of the sauce was decent your usual sweet tangy New York style sauce and the pizza crust wasn't as crispy as I'd like it to be so over all the flavors were okay the pizza was decent
I am born and bred Hoboken NJ, just across the Hudson from NYC. This is the closest to NYC pizza, and I have had more than my share of before they were famous John's on Bleeker and Original Ray's.
Dat pizza tho... The owner Simon is an awesome guy!!!!

I ordered a slice of veggie pizza that came out a little on the cold soggy side. I informed the young lady behind the counter. She said it was doggie because of the veggies. I didn't want to argue as to why pizza should not be soggy so instead I asked for a slice if cheese instead. Then a young man from behind a laptop chimed in to inform he had tried all the pizzas there and my pizza was in fact not soggy and he knew it wasn't because he had just taken that slice out of the fridge. I'm guessing it was yesterday's pizza. As the two of them were bickering over my request for non soggy pizza I decided to sacrifice my $4.50, leave the soggy pizza unconsumed and get some Toro sushi (which is best sushi place in the city and right next store)

Great pizza? Check. Decent prices? Check. Surly owner? Check.  Everything you could want from an authentic ny style pizza place. If Chicago style pie and Midwestern service leaves you longing for the coast, this is the place for you. Try the garlic knots!
I miss NY don't get me wrong but as far as NY style Pizza Cafe Luigi is the best I've found...I'm shocked this place doesn't get more attention.
One of the better NY style pizza joints in Chicago.   A bit too salty in my opinion, but still good.
For thin crust pizza, this is where we go. Although, the taste is nothing out of the standard cheese etc thin crusts.

Luigi's has the worst pizza I have ever had. It's that simple. The crust was bland. There was no sauce, just crust with cheese and then sausage on top. The sausage had no spice. The cheese was grocery store quality. This was simply horrible. If you want better pizza, go to Bricks or Giordanos. If you want something close go to Renaldis on Broadway. Stay away from this place.
